content:
Hi, Yes you could use the filters for that: - Create the folder you want to use for the messages from this recipient. - Tools> Message filters - Then click on a new filter and follow the steps. - See the screenshot for some ideas. (if you cannot see it, please let me know and I will describe it here)

Have a nice day!
creator: shopov.bogomil

content:
hi, Does the problem appeared recently?

Some things that helped other people:

- You need to login via webmail and see whether you exceeded the quota you have. (limit of 500MB by default) - refer to https://www.optus.com.au/for-you/support/answer?id=1434 for the correct settings: mail.optusnet.com.au, port 25, security=none, authentication = password, transmitted insecurely, User Name = part of address before the @. - there is also a conversation at another website, saying that optus might be canceling their e-mail service to some of the domains (search for it, I am not gonna put it here)
creator: shopov.bogomil

content:
Třeba to není žádná"chyba" Thunderbirdu. Ono je spíše pravděpodobné, že poštovní server omezuje interval přístupu k účtům. "Online" to rozhodně nejde nikde, to by se považovalo za pokus o útok na server a tomu se poštovní servery brání.

Pokud jde o nějaký podnikový poštovní server, zkuste kontaktovat jeho správce/admina.
creator: poljos-moz

content: To change the default account, click 'account setting' pane, then highlight the desired new default account on left side of pane, scroll down slightly to "Account Actions' menu and click to make the account the default.

Actually, it's Xfinity, not Thunderbird. Xfinity has its own requirements for using an email client. These two articles may assist:

https://www.xfinity.com/support/articles/third-party-email-access

https://www.xfinity.com/support/articles/email-client-programs-with-xfinity-email

content:
I figured it out. ATT.NET uses secure email key. Even though I changed my ATT.NET login PW, it did not prevent Thunderbird from prompting me for a PW; since a previously established secure email key was set up.

I'll mark this as resolved.
creator: mkal1

content: The default setting in Thunderbird for message folders is threaded. That may be your issue. You can change that by highlighting the inbox folder, and at menu bar click view>sort by and tick 'unthreaded.'
creator: davidsk

content: Some email providers require unique passwords for use with email clients (Gmail is an example), so knowing the email provider may prove helpful.
creator: davidsk

content: Have you checked with Comcast, such as about the certificate? The fact that it works sometimes indicates a problem somewhere in the internet. You aside comment on Gmail was puzzling: POP accounts work fine with Gmail.
